abstract.text: Represents a Discord bot.
Disconnect from Discord and clears the cache.
All channels the bot has access to.
Controls what will/won’t be cached.
Create a guild. Your bot must be in less than 10 guilds to use this.
Request a guild. This is an API call. For general use purposes, use
instead if you have the
intent enabled.
Adds a message command.  The command will not be available unless synced via
Retrieve a user from the bots internal cache.
Creates a DM channel between the bot and a user.
The global allowed mentions.
All guilds the bot is a member of.
All users the bot can see.
Dispatched when the bot has connected to Discord. This is different from
because this will dispatch as
soon as the connection is successful. Meaning depending on how many guilds the bot is in, the initial preparation of the internal cache may or may not be complete.
Update the bots presence.
Retrieve a member from the bots internal cache.
Retrieve all global application commands. If you need the commands for a specific guild, use
Version of the library.
Retrieve all application commands for the guild.
Initializes the Discord bot.
The private messages currently opened between the bot and a user.
Set the closure that’s executed when the bot has connected to Discord. Unlike
and
tasks under those events can be executed multiple times throughout uptime. This guarantees the closure given will be executed exactly one time. The closure
will not be executed after the
is successful.
Enable all event listeners.
Intents currently set for the bot.
Adds a user command.  The command will not be available unless synced via
Connect to Discord and blocks the app from exiting.
Messages the bot has cached.
Request a webhook by its ID.
Disconnect from Discord and releases the block from
Retrieve an event listener by its name.
Adds a slash command.  The command will not be available unless synced via
Represents a Discord bot.
Request a sticker. This is an API call. For general use purposes, use
instead.
Retrieve a message from the bots internal cache.
Add event listeners to the bot.
Retrieves the bots application information.
Retrieve all entitlements for a given app, active and expired.
The bots user object. Will be
if the bot is not connected to Discord.
Retrieve all SKU’s for a given application
Request a Discord invite.
Creates a test entitlement to a given SKU for a given guild or user. Discord will act as though that user or guild has entitlement to your premium offering.
After creating a test entitlement, you’ll need to reload your Discord app. After doing so, you’ll see that your server or user now has premium access.
Sync all application commands. This must be called in order for application commands to be visible.
Request the sticker packs available with Discord Nitro.
All emojis the bot has accesss to.
Request a webhook by its URL. Unlike
, this does not require authentification. Meaning this can be called prior to connecting to Discord via
The authentification token for the bot. It is truncated by default, see parameter
Retrieve a sticker from this guilds internal cache.
Dispatched when the bot has connected to Discord and the internal cache has completed its initial preparation.
Request a guild template based on the provided code. The code is the last parameter of the template URL.
Template URLs look like the following:
, where “VhauskbbByvn” is the code.
Retrieve a guild from the bots internal cache.
Connect to Discord.
All member voice connection statuses.
Retrieve an emoji from the bots internal cache.
Event listeners that have been added to the bot.
Retrieve a channel from the bots internal cache.

Whether automatic sharding is enabled. If your bot is in 2500 or more guilds, this
be enabled.
